articles.headline: Vogue’s Fashion Photos Spark Debate in India
articles.snippet: The juxtaposition between poverty and growing wealth presents an unsavory dilemma for luxury goods makers jumping into India.
articles.abstract: The juxtaposition between poverty and growing wealth presents an unsavory dilemma for luxury goods makers jumping into India.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI  An old woman missing her upper front teeth holds a child in rumpled clothes  who is wearing a Fendi bib (retail price, about $100).

articles.headline: For Web TV, a Handful of Hits but No Formula for Success
articles.snippet: Hollywood writers and producers are realizing that producing Web content may be easy but profiting from it is hard.
articles.abstract: Hollywood writers and producers are realizing that producing Web content may be easy but profiting from it is hard.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the Writers Guild of America strike stopped television production last fall and winter, Hollywood writers and producers rushed to create new scripted series for the Web, often called webisodes for lack of a more artful term. The strategy seemed simple: make money by going straight to the Internet.

articles.headline: A Long and Weary Bus Ride to Anywhere, Haunted by Memories
articles.snippet: On a bus taking evacuees from New Orleans, no one seemed to know where they were going or what they would come home to.
articles.abstract: On a bus taking evacuees from New Orleans, no one seemed to know where they were going or what they would come home to.
articles.lead_paragraph: ABOARD A BUS FROM NEW ORLEANS  The 40-odd people boarding the black, red and white bus that the city provided late Saturday afternoon embarked on a journey of pure faith. They did not know how long they would be away or whether they would have anything to come home to. It would be many hours before they even learned where they were going.

articles.headline: Storm Politics Present Risks and Rewards
articles.snippet: The hurricane’s approach recalled failings of the Bush presidency just as John McCain’s big moment arrived.
articles.abstract: The hurricane’s approach recalled failings of the Bush presidency just as John McCain’s big moment arrived.
articles.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL  On the day Hurricane Katrina made landfall three years ago, President Bush helped Senator John McCain celebrate his birthday with a cake that melted on a blazing hot airport tarmac, just as the president’s approval ratings would in the weeks to come.

articles.headline: Party’s Plans Are Unsettled; McCain Visits Gulf
articles.snippet: Senator John McCain called a halt to all but the most essential activities for the Republican convention.
articles.abstract: Senator John McCain called a halt to all but the most essential activities for the Republican convention.
articles.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL  Senator John McCain and his advisers decided on Sunday to halt all but the most essential activities for the Republican National Convention on Monday, sacrificing a major televised platform for his political message as Mr. McCain seeks to project a forceful response to the threat of Hurricane Gustav.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Adam Nagourney

articles.headline: U.S. Hands Off Pacified Anbar, Once Heart of Iraq Insurgency
articles.snippet: The handover of the Iraqi province, once a stronghold of the Sunni insurgency, marked a long-delayed milestone.
articles.abstract: The handover of the Iraqi province, once a stronghold of the Sunni insurgency, marked a long-delayed milestone.
articles.lead_paragraph: RAMADI, Iraq — Two years ago, Anbar Province was the most lethal place for the Americans in Iraq, with a marine or a soldier dying here nearly every day. The provincial capital, Ramadi, was a moonscape of rubble and ruins. Islamic extremists controlled large pieces of territory, with some so ferocious in their personal views that they did not even allow the sale of bread.
